sen.j: もともとは、因果や道理に違背・違逆して、人間の倫理に反する言動や行為により仏道に違背することであるが、後に仏法を誹謗したことが逆に縁となって、仏法に帰依するような場合も指すようになった。
sen.e: The gyaku-en originally meant the act of opposing Buddhism by defying fate and order as well as by making unethical remarks and committing unethical acts; subsequently, however, the word also began to indicate the case where criticizing Buddhism triggered inversely one to become a monk.

sen.j: 法華経の方便品第2で、肝心な教えが説かれる前に5000人の増上慢の比丘が去ったという「五千起去」（ごせんきこ、ききょ）は、逆縁の典型的な例といわれる。
sen.e: The incident 'Gosenkiko, or Gosenkikyo' in which five thousand of arrogant ascetic monks, believing in having become enlightened, left before being taught the crucial lessons in the chapter 2 of the Buddha's words in the Hoke-kyo Sutra (the Lotus Sutra), is said to have been a classic example of the gyaku-en.
